revision.comment: Monaco is NOT part of France. See [[Monaco]] wiki page.

{{Use dmy dates|date=August 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Antonio Barreca | image = | caption = | fullname = <!--if different--> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1995|3|18|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Turin]], Italy | height = 1.80m | position = [[Full-back (football)|Full-back]] | currentclub = [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] (on loan from [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]]) | clubnumber = 23 | youthyears1 = 2002–2014 | youthclubs1 = [[Torino F.C.|Torino]] | years1 = 2014–2018 | clubs1 = [[Torino F.C.|Torino]] | caps1 = 37 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2014–2015 | clubs2 = → [[A.S. Cittadella|Cittadella]] (loan) | caps2 = 38 | goals2 = 1 | years3 = 2015–2016 | clubs3 = → [[Cagliari Calcio|Cagliari]] (loan) | caps3 = 15 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2018– | clubs4 = [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] | caps4 = 9 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2019– |clubs5 = → [[Newcastle United FC|Newcastle United]] (loan) |caps5 = 1 | goals5 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2012–2013 | nationalteam1 = [[Italy national under-18 football team|Italy U18]] | nationalcaps1 = 6 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2013 | nationalteam2 = [[Italy national under-19 football team|Italy U19]] | nationalcaps2 = 4 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2014 | nationalteam3 = [[Italy national under-20 football team|Italy U20]] | nationalcaps3 = 1 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2015–2017 | nationalteam4 = [[Italy national under-21 football team|Italy U21]] | nationalcaps4 = 13 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | medaltemplates = <!-- don't include medal templates unless there is a medal {{MedalSport | Association football }} {{MedalCountry | {{ITA}} }} --> | pcupdate = 14:34, 2 February 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 27 June 2017 }} '''Antonio Barreca''' (born 18 March 1995) is an Italian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Premier League]] club [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]], on loan from [[Ligue 1]] club [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]].
==Club career==
===Early career=== Born in [[Turin]] to [[Sicily|Sicilian]] parents, he grew up in the [[Torino F.C.|Torino]] youth, where he played for each youth category up to the ''[[Torino F.C. Primavera|Primavera]]''.<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20141216093035/http://toronext.com/2014/09/24/antonio-barreca-qualita-ce-si-vede/]</ref> In 2013–14, he led the Primavera to the finals of the [[Campionato Nazionale Primavera|Campionato Primavera]], lost on penalties to [[A.C. Chievo Verona|Chievo]].<ref name=youthcareer>{{cite web|title=Antonio Barreca, il Torino ha trovato il terzino del futuro |url=http://www.iltalentocheverra.it/anteprima/antonio-barreca-il-torino-ha-trovato-il-terzino-del-futuro/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140412235910/http://www.iltalentocheverra.it/anteprima/antonio-barreca-il-torino-ha-trovato-il-terzino-del-futuro/ |dead-url=yes |archive-date=12 April 2014 |website=iltalentocheverra.it |accessdate=12 September 2014 |language=Italian }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Regolamento del Campionato Primavera TIM 2012/2013 – "Trofeo Giacinto Facchetti" |url=http://www.legaseriea.it/c/document_library/get_file?uuid=b1faef1a-c5ce-4c60-bd3c-daed21541321&groupId=10192 |format=PDF |work=legaseriea.it |publisher=[[Lega Serie A|Lega Nazionale Professionisti Serie A]] |date=13 July 2012 |accessdate=29 January 2014 |language=Italian}}</ref> Coinciding with Torino's injury problems that season he was regularly called up to the first team by [[Giampiero Ventura]].
====Loans to Cittadella and Cagliari==== In his first season as a professional, Barreca was sent on loan to [[A.S. Cittadella|Cittadella]] in [[Serie B]]. He made his debut in the [[2014–15 Coppa Italia#Third round|third round]] of [[2014–15 Coppa Italia|Coppa Italia]], lost 4–1 to [[U.S. Sassuolo Calcio|Sassuolo]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/08/21/italy/coppa-italia/us-sassuolo-calcio/as-cittadella/1904847/|title=Sassuolo vs. Cittadella - 21 August 2014 - Soccerway|website=int.soccerway.com}}</ref> Barreca scored his first goal in [[Serie B]] on 15 November 2014 in a 5–2 away loss to [[Carpi FC 1909|Carpi]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/11/15/italy/serie-b/carpi-fc-1909/as-cittadella/1882395/|title=Carpi vs. Cittadella - 15 November 2014 - Soccerway|website=int.soccerway.com}}</ref>
On 17 June 2015, he was loaned to [[Cagliari F.C.|Cagliari]] with a buyout clause and buy back clause in favour of Torino.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://m.tuttomercatoweb.com/serie-a/ufficiale-torino-preso-avelar-dal-cagliari-barreca-in-prestito-in-sardegna-693179 |title=UFFICIALE: Torino, preso Avelar dal Cagliari. Barreca in prestito in Sardegna - TUTTOmercatoWEB.com |website=M.tuttomercatoweb.com |date=17 June 2015 |accessdate=6 July 2017}}</ref> He made his debut with the ''Sardi'' in the eighth round, away to [[Novara Calcio|Novara]] (1–0). He made 15 appearances for Cagliari, led by [[Massimo Rastelli]], who won the championship and were promoted to Serie A. On 26 June 2016 his contract was redeemed by Torino.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://torinofc.it/news/23/06/2016/barreca-al-toro_11518 |title=Barreca al Toro | TORINO FC 1906 SITO UFFICIALE |language=it |website=Torinofc.it |date= |accessdate=6 July 2017}}</ref>
===Torino=== He made his debut for Torino on 13 August 2016, in the [[2016–17 Coppa Italia#Third round|third round]] of the [[2016–17 Coppa Italia|Coppa Italia]], won 4–1 against [[Pro Vercelli]] at the [[Stadio Olimpico Grande Torino]]. On 18 September, at age 21, he made his debut in [[Serie A]], entering as a substitute for [[Christian Molinaro]] in the first half of the match Torino Empoli (0–0). In December 2016 he was awarded the best young player of the year by the USSI (Unione Stampa Sportiva Italiana).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tuttosport.com/news/calcio/serie-a/torino/2016/12/13-18694659/torino_barreca_rivelazione_dellanno_il_premio_dellussi/?cookieAccept |title=Torino, Barreca "rivelazione dell'anno": il premio dell'Ussi |publisher=Tuttosport |date=13 December 2016 |accessdate=6 July 2017}}</ref>
===Monaco=== On 10 July 2018, he was sold to [[Ligue 1]] club [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]].<ref>http://torinofc.it/news/10/07/2018/barreca-allas-monaco-fc_18033</ref>
====Loan to Newcastle United==== On 31 January 2019, Barreca joined [[Premier League]] side [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] on loan until the end of the 2018–19 season.<ref>https://www.nufc.co.uk/news/latest-news/antonio-barreca-joins-newcastle-united</ref>
==International career== He represented the [[Italy national under-20 football team|Italy U-20]] team on 6 January 2013 in a match valid for the [[Under-20 Four Nations Tournament]]. ''Gli Azzurrini'' lost 2–1 away to [[Poland national under-20 football team|Poland]].
He made his debut with the [[Italy national under-21 football team|Italy U-21]] squad on 12 August 2015, in a friendly match against [[Hungary national under-21 football team|Hungary]], played in [[Telki]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://torinofc.it/news/04/08/2015/aramu-e-benassi-nazionale-under-21_9022 |title=Aramu e Benassi in Nazionale Under 21 | TORINO FC 1906 SITO UFFICIALE |language=it |website=Torinofc.it |date= |accessdate=6 July 2017}}</ref>
In June 2017, he was included in the Italy under-21 squad for the [[2017 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]] by manager [[Luigi Di Biagio]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.football-italia.net/103752/u21-italy-squad-euros-named|title=U21: Italy squad for Euros named|publisher=Football Italia|date=6 June 2017|accessdate=16 June 2017}}</ref>
==Style of play== Barreca mainly covers the role of a left full-back or [[Leftwingback|wing-back]], but is often used with good results as a [[Left winger|winger]]: he has notable speed, [[Cross (football)|crossing]] ability and vision of the game.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.calciomercato.com/news/barreca-a-cm-mi-voleva-il-milan-sogno-di-giocare-in-rossonero-co-984806|title=Barreca a CM: 'Mi ha cercato il Milan'|publisher=CalcioMercato.com|language=Italian|author=Federico Ciapparoni|date=19 December 2014|accessdate=20 April 2017}}</ref>
==Career statistics==
